info.title: OPERA Cloud Room Configuration API
info.description:
APIs to cater for room configuration, such as configuring room types, room Classes, creating new room features, or updating housekeeping room maintenance reasons.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 25.1.0.0.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2025 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

get.description:
Use this API to return bed type requests based on search criteria such as fetchInactive, codes, wildCard, description.

Bed types are referenced in room type configuration to identify the bed configuration in the room.

OperationId:getBedTypeRequests

parameters.name: fetchInactive
parameters.description: Determines wether to fetch inactive records or not.

200.description: Response object for fetching Bed Type Requests.

post.description:
Use this API to create bed type requests.

Bed types are referenced in room type configuration to identify the bed configuration in the room.

parameters.name: bedTypeRequestsCriteria
parameters.description: Request object for creating Bed Type Requests.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:

Bed types are referenced in room type configuration to identify the bed configuration in the room.

Bed types are referenced in room type configuration to identify the bed configuration in the room.

get.description:
Use this API to return housekeeping credit rules for a specific hotel based on search criteria such as hotelId, ruleCodes, ruleType, includeInactive.

Housekeeping credit rules are used to add additional credits to the housekeeping tasks sheets depending on configured values i.e. travel credits between buildings, or floors, or inventory items i.e. cribs, rollaways.

OperationId:getHousekeepingCreditRules

parameters.name: ruleType
parameters.description: A Facility Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when certain task conditions exist. Multiple Facility Task Rules will be applied on top of each other if the conditions are met. A Miscellaneous Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when the attendants are occupied with anything other than cleaning a room, for example a team meeting. A Special Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when the defined Specials are attached to a reservation. A Traveling Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when rooms from multiple Buildings, Section Groups, Sections and/or Floors are assigned. An Inventory Item Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when the defined Items are attached to a reservation.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Flag to indicate if inactive credit rules should be included.

200.description: Response object for fetching housekeeping credit rules.

post.description:
Use this API to create housekeeping credit rules for a specific hotel.

Housekeeping credit rules are used to add additional credits to the housekeeping tasks sheets depending on configured values i.e. travel credits between buildings, or floors, or inventory items i.e. cribs, rollaways.

OperationId:postHousekeepingCreditRules

parameters.name: housekeepingCreditRulesCriteria
parameters.description: Request object for creating housekeeping credit rules.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
Use this API to update housekeeping credit rules for a specific hotel based on code, hotelId, housekeepingCreditRulesToBeChanged.

Housekeeping credit rules are used to add additional credits to the housekeeping tasks sheets depending on configured values i.e. travel credits between buildings, or floors, or inventory items i.e. cribs, rollaways.

OperationId:changeHousekeepingCreditRules

parameters.name: housekeepingCreditRulesToBeChanged
parameters.description: Request object for changing housekeeping credit rules.

200.description: Response Body.

delete.description:

Housekeeping credit rules are used to add additional credits to the housekeeping tasks sheets depending on configured values i.e. travel credits between buildings, or floors, or inventory items i.e. cribs, rollaways.

OperationId:removeHousekeepingCreditRules

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.summary: Get information related to housekeeping tasksheet rooms
get.description:
Use this API to return information related to housekeeping tasksheet rooms for a specific hotel based on search criteria such as hotelId, building, floor, roomType, daySection, eveningSection, fromRoom, toRoom. Task Sheets inform housekeeping room attendants about their daily work assignments; providing a list of rooms assigned to attendants, any special instructions about specific rooms, and related reservations details.

OperationId:getHousekeepingTaskSheetRooms

parameters.name: building
parameters.description: Building code for which the housekeeping rooms have to be searched. This criteria can be applied only if the BUILDINGS parameter is active.

parameters.name: floor
parameters.description: Floor code for which the housekeeping rooms have to be searched

parameters.name: roomType
parameters.description: Room type for which the housekeeping rooms have to be searched

parameters.name: daySection
parameters.description: Day section code for which the housekeeping rooms have to be searched. This criteria can be applied only if the HOUSEKEEPING_SECTIONS parameter is active.

parameters.name: eveningSection
parameters.description: Evening section code for which the housekeeping rooms have to be searched. This criteria can be applied only if the HOUSEKEEPING_SECTIONS parameter is active.

parameters.name: fromRoom
parameters.description: From Room code for which the housekeeping rooms have to be searched

parameters.name: toRoom
parameters.description: To Room code for which the housekeeping rooms have to be searched

200.description: Response object for fetching details about housekeeping tasksheet rooms.

put.summary: set information related to housekeeping tasksheet rooms
put.description:
Use this API to update information related to housekeeping tasksheet rooms for a specific hotel based on hotelId, setHousekeepingTaskSheetRooms.Task Sheets inform housekeeping room attendants about their daily work assignments; providing a list of rooms assigned to attendants, any special instructions about specific rooms, and related reservations details.

OperationId:setHousekeepingTaskSheetRooms

parameters.name: setHousekeepingTaskSheetRooms
parameters.description: Request object for setting details about housekeeping tasksheet rooms.

200.description: Response Body.

get.summary: Get Out Of Order Service Reasons
get.description:
Use this API to return out of order service reasons for a specific hotel based on search criteria such as hotelId, includeInactive, limit offset, reasonCodes. Out of order (OO) and out of service (OS) are two additional housekeeping statuses. These options are used when changing the status for rooms that should not be sold due to damage, maintenance, low occupancy wing, etc.

OperationId:getOutOfOrderServiceReasons

The maximum allowable limit for this API is 1000.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Indicator that tells whether to include inactive out of order/service reasons in search results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

200.description: Response object for fetching Out of Order/Service Reason(s).

post.summary: Create Out Of Order Service Reasons
post.description:
Use this API to create out of order service reasons for a specific hotel. Out of order (OO) and out of service (OS) are two additional housekeeping statuses. These options are used when changing the status for rooms that should not be sold due to damage, maintenance, low occupancy wing, etc.

OperationId:postOutOfOrderServiceReasons

parameters.name: outOfOrderServiceReasonsCriteria
parameters.description: Request object for creating new out of order/service reasons for hotels.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.summary: Change Out Of Order Service Reasons
put.description:
Use this API to update out of order service reasons for a specific hotel based on reasonCode, hotelId, outOfOrderServiceReasonsToBeChanged.Out of order (OO) and out of service (OS) are two additional housekeeping statuses. These options are used when changing the status for rooms that should not be sold due to damage, maintenance, low occupancy wing, etc.

OperationId:changeOutOfOrderServiceReasons

parameters.name: outOfOrderServiceReasonsToBeChanged
parameters.description: Request object for modifying out of order/service reasons for hotels.

200.description: Response Body.

delete.summary: Delete Out Of Order Service Reasons
delete.description:
Use this API to delete out of order service reasons for a specific hotel based on reasonCode, hotelId. Out of order (OO) and out of service (OS) are two additional housekeeping statuses. These options are used when changing the status for rooms that should not be sold due to damage, maintenance, low occupancy wing, etc.

OperationId:removeOutOfOrderServiceReasons

200.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

externalData.name: externalData
externalData.description: Pass this header as true, if payload needs DVM

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

x-hubid.name: x-hubid
x-hubid.description: x-hubid is a logical grouping of multiple properties that allows api consumers to manage data from a group of properties. This x-hubid is a valid list of hub codes configured in OPERA to which the user has access. Rest APIs without hotelId in the operation path can support hub level integration using x-hubid

bedTypeRequestsDetails.description: Response object for fetching Bed Type Requests.

translationTextType2000.description: Contains Multiple translated texts and language codes.

defaultText.description: Default text with Character length from 0 to 2000.

translatedTexts.description: List of translated text and language codes.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

ruleType.description: Rule Type of housekeeping credit rule.

facilityTaskRule.description: When RuleType is set to FacilityTask, specifies task code and minimum task count.

taskCode.description: When RuleType is set to FacilityTask, specifies which task code makes this credit rule applicable. For example, the credit value will be added to the task assignment sheet when this specific task code is assigned.

minimumTaskCount.description: When RuleType is set to FacilityTask, specifies the minimum number of the facility task that must be assigned to a sheet before the rule is applicable to that sheet.

special.description: When RuleType is set to Special, specifies which special makes this credit rule applicable. For example, the credit value will be added to the task assignment sheet when the assigned room has this specific special applied to the reservation.

travelType.description: When RuleType is set to Travelling, specifies multiples of what unit makes this credit rule applicable. Possible values are Buildings, Section Groups, Sections, or Floors. For example, the credit value will be added to the task assignment sheet when there are rooms from multiple buildings, section groups, sections, or floors assigned.

creditValue.description: The additional credits which are applied to the task assignment sheet when the rule criteria has been met.

buildings.description: List of buildings codes to which the credit rule is applicable. If no building codes are provided, the rule is applicable to the entire hotel. This element is only applicable when the parameter for BUILDINGS is active.

daysOfWeek.description: Days of the week for which the credit rule is automatically applied to task sheets. If no days of the week are specified the rule must be applied manually.

inactive.description: Indicates if the Housekeeping Credit Rule is inactive.

itemInventory.description: When RuleType is set to Item Inventory, specifies which item inventory makes this credit rule applicable. For example, the credit value will be added to the task assignment sheet when the assigned room has this specific item inventory applied to the reservation.

housekeepingCreditRuleTypeType.description: A Facility Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when certain task conditions exist. Multiple Facility Task Rules will be applied on top of each other if the conditions are met. A Miscellaneous Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when the attendants are occupied with anything other than cleaning a room, for example a team meeting. A Special Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when the defined Specials are attached to a reservation. A Traveling Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when rooms from multiple Buildings, Section Groups, Sections and/or Floors are assigned. An Inventory Item Rule will add extra credit to a task assignment sheet when the defined Items are attached to a reservation.

housekeepingCreditRuleTravelTypeType.description: Applies to rooms across multiple section groups.

timeSpanType.description: Allows for a choice in description of the amount of time spanned by this type. EndDate specifies a specific date, while Duration provides a measure of time to add to the StartDate to yield end date.
